questions.question: What is the primary characteristic of an ohmic contact?

answers.b: It allows current to flow easily in both directions.
answers.c: It only conducts current in one direction.
answers.d: It has a nonlinear I-V relationship.

explanations.a: Incorrect. Ohmic contacts are defined by low resistance.
explanations.b: Correct! Ohmic contacts facilitate easy current flow in both directions.
explanations.c: Incorrect. This describes a rectifying contact, not an ohmic contact.
explanations.d: Incorrect. Ohmic contacts exhibit a linear I-V relationship.

questions.question: What role does doping play in the formation of ohmic contacts?

answers.a: It increases the resistance of the contact.
answers.b: It provides sufficient charge carriers at the interface.
answers.c: It has no effect on the contact properties.
answers.d: It only affects the thermal stability of the junction.

explanations.a: Incorrect. Doping is used to lower resistance.
explanations.b: Correct! Doping increases the number of charge carriers, facilitating current flow.
explanations.c: Incorrect. Doping is crucial for contact properties.
explanations.d: Incorrect. Doping affects electrical properties, not just thermal stability.

questions.question: Which metal is commonly used to form ohmic contacts with n-type silicon?

explanations.a: Incorrect. Gold is not typically used for ohmic contacts with n-type silicon.
explanations.b: Correct! Aluminum is widely used due to its good conductivity and compatibility.
explanations.c: Incorrect. Copper can form good contacts but is less common than aluminum.
explanations.d: Incorrect. Silver is not commonly used for this purpose.

questions.question: What is the effect of temperature on the contact resistance of ohmic contacts?

answers.a: Temperature has no effect on contact resistance.
answers.b: Higher temperatures generally increase contact resistance.
answers.c: Higher temperatures can decrease contact resistance.
answers.d: Contact resistance is only affected by the material used.

explanations.a: Incorrect. Temperature can significantly affect contact resistance.
explanations.b: Incorrect. Higher temperatures can lead to increased carrier mobility.
explanations.c: Correct! Higher temperatures can decrease contact resistance due to increased carrier mobility.
explanations.d: Incorrect. While material affects resistance, temperature also plays a role.

questions.question: What is the relationship between current density (J) and electric field (E) in a semiconductor?

answers.b: J is directly proportional to E.
answers.c: J is inversely proportional to E.

explanations.a: Incorrect. Current density is affected by the electric field.
explanations.b: Correct! Current density is directly proportional to the electric field.
explanations.c: Incorrect. This is not the correct relationship.
explanations.d: Incorrect. Current density is not equal to the electric field.

questions.question: What is the significance of the work function in the context of metal-semiconductor junctions?

answers.a: It determines the thermal conductivity of the metal.
answers.b: It affects the barrier height at the junction.
answers.c: It has no relevance to the junction properties.
answers.d: It only influences the mechanical properties of the junction.

explanations.a: Incorrect. The work function is not related to thermal conductivity.
explanations.b: Correct! The work function influences the barrier height and thus the contact behavior.
explanations.c: Incorrect. The work function is crucial for understanding junction properties.
explanations.d: Incorrect. The work function does not influence mechanical properties.
